Key Match Events: OG Anunoby scored 24 points and led the New York Knicks to a 111-99 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers.
Joel Embiid made his season debut for the 76ers, finishing with 13 points in 26 minutes.
Paul George led the 76ers with 29 points and 10 rebounds.
Josh Hart recorded a triple-double with 14 points, 12 rebounds, and 10 assists for the Knicks.
Karl-Anthony Towns contributed 21 points and 13 rebounds for the Knicks.
Jalen Brunson scored 18 points for the Knicks.
New York started the fourth quarter on a 13-2 run, breaking open a three-point game.
Post-Match Reflections: Joel Embiid appeared rusty in his first action since the gold medal game of the Paris Olympics on Aug. 10.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Knicks recorded 31 assists on 44 field goals and shot 49% from the floor.
